docblock.description: ValidForm Builder - build valid and secure web forms quickly
docblock.long-description:

docblock.description: Group fields together in an Area
docblock.long-description: An Area can be used to group form fields together. When an Area is active, it can toggle the disabled state on all it's child form fields using the auto-generated checkbox in the Area's legend.

docblock.description: The Area's label, presented as a 'legend' header above the area
Make this an active area with __active set on true. When active, the entire area can be enabled and disabled with a checkbox.
Use in combination with 'active'; defines if the active area is checked by default or not
Defines if this area is dynamic
The label used by __addDynamicHtml() which a user can click to clone this dynamic area

Using the dynamic 'setRequiredStyle()', you can add for instance an asterix to each required field like so: $this->setRequiredStyle('%s *'); // First show the label, %s, then show an asterix after the label.
The child fields collection
Create a new Area instance
docblock.long-description:
The label is used as a small 'header' above the area. When setting an area to 'active', this label becomes clickable using a checkbox. This clickable header can toggle child fields to be enabled / disabled.
**We strongly encourage you to use `\ValidFormBuilder\ValidForm->addArea()` instead of creating your own area instances.**
Super short example:
``` <?php new \ValidFormBuilder\Area("Cool area label", true, "cool-area", true); ?> ```

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether the area should be active or not. When active, a checkbox will be prefixed to the header.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether or not the active area should be checked by default

docblock.description: Add a field to the Area.
docblock.long-description:
Example adding a string field to the area:
``` <?php $objArea = $objForm->addArea("Cool area"); $objArea->addField("first-name", "First name", ValidForm::VFORM_STRING); ?> ```

tag.name: return
tag.description: <NULL, \ValidFormBuilder\Element> Returns an instance of the field type generated

docblock.description: Add paragraph to Area
docblock.long-description:
Example:
``` <?php $objArea->addParagraph( "Cool paragraph with lots of text in it. It's an absolute must-read.", "You must read this" ); ?> ```

docblock.description: Add a multifield to the Area
Render the Area and it's children with toHtml()

tag.name: param
tag.description: Define if the area has been submitted and propagate that flag to the child fields

docblock.description: Verify if any of the child fields in this area has submitted data

tag.name: param
tag.description: Optional counter to do the same for dynamic multifields.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if area childs contain submitted data, false if not.

docblock.description: Same as toHtml() but with dynamic counter as extra parameter

tag.name: param
tag.description: Define if the area has been submitted and propagate that flag to the child fields

docblock.description: Generate extra HTML output to facilitate the dynamic duplication logic
Generate Javascript code.
Check if this is an active area
Verify if all submitted data of this area and it's children is valid.
Check if this area is a dynamic area
Get the dynamic counter value if this is an dynamic area.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Defaults to 0 if not an dynamic area. If dynamic, this returns the number of times the user duplicated this area.

docblock.description: Return all children in a Collection
If this is an active area, this will return the value of the checkbox.
Return the Area name
For API compatibility, we've added the placeholder method 'getType'
Check if this area contains child objects.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if fields collection > 0, false if not.

docblock.description: Validate this Area and it's children's submitted values

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if Area and children are valid, false if not.

docblock.description: ValidForm Builder - build valid and secure web forms quickly
docblock.long-description:

docblock.description: ValidForm Builder
docblock.long-description: Create a new ValidForm Builder instance like this: ``` $objForm = new ValidForm("cool_new_form", "Please fill out my cool form", "/awesome-submits"); ```

docblock.description: The form's description paragraph content
Form's custom meta like style, classes etc.
Default values array
The HTML <form>-tag's 'action' attribute value
The submit button's label
An array of custom javascript events to include in javascript parsing
The main elements Collection
The form's name
The main alert to be shown when any alert has happened after trying to submit.
Define the field required style. Note: **This value will be passed to `sprintf`** so be sure to throw in an %s.
This message is shown in `valuesAsHtml()` output when for example an area or fieldset don't contain any submitted values.
The collection of cached fields.
A uniquely generated string to identify the form with.
Create an instance of the ValidForm Builder

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name and id of the form in the HTML DOM and JavaScript.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Desriptive text which is displayed above the form.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Form action. If left empty the form will post to itself.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array with meta data. The array gets directly parsed into the form tag with the keys as attribute names and the values as values.

docblock.description: Use an array to set default values on all the forms children.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The array of default values. Keys are field names, values strings or arrays

docblock.description: Use addHtml to inject custom HTML code in the form.
Set the navigation of the form. Overides the default navigation (submit button).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Array with meta data. Only the "style" attribute is supported as of now

docblock.description: Add a fieldset to the form field collection
Generate HTML output - build form
Serialize, compress and encode the entire form including it's values

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether or not to include submitted values or only serialize default values.

docblock.description: Unserialize previously serialized ValidForm object
Check if the form is submitted by validating the value of the hidden vf__dispatch field.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Fake isSubmitted to true to force field values.

docblock.description: Fetch a cached flat collection of form fields instead of making an expensive getFields() call and looping through all elements
Generate a random name for the form.
Generate a random number between 10000000 and 90000000.
